column4: if were to upgrade my ram of a laptop what all do i need to know? max capacity for each slot, max speed allowed, type sdram or ddr-sdram etc?
Ram type.
Does it matter who makes the ram?
do they have to be from the same manufacturer
Sometimes.
Laptop manufacturers don't make RAM.
what about speed of ram?
Usually not an issue. DDR2-800 (if you use DDR2) would downscale to whatever speed you need.
does not support ddr2-800?
Not OS Specific.
that is what dell says it doesn't sell faster ram becuase ubuntu doesn't support it
Corsair, Kingston, and Crucial all make SODIMMs
i bought a dell studio 15n with ubuntu 8.04 and i paid 100 to upgrade to 4gb from 2gb ram.  I think i should of bought and installed the ram for cheaper
100 for an extra 2gb is a rip off
It'll always be cheaper to do upgrades yourself, if you don't manage to kill something.
so that was a bad deal i found 2gb sticks 667mhz for 25
Probably. d
but i was worried about compatibility
Compatibility is rarely an issue. Sometimes though.
does the ubuntu support 1066 mhz fsb?
Doesn't matter.
dell said they didn't
Find real techsupport.
